Service Details: - Works to create a typical university or college experience with academic and social life for students with developmental disabilities- Students select courses based on personal interests, direct their own course of studies and select the concentration of studies in a specific field- Students do not attend separate classes, classrooms or have separate curricula
Eligibility: Ages: 19 year(s) and up- Eligibility is based on the individual- Having a developmental disability- Being 19 years or older and not attending other secondary or post-secondary education programs- Wanting to study at college or university, and be an active participant in other aspects of student life such as activities, sports, clubs, and employment- Willing to commit to the time required to complete their studies, which can vary from 1-5 years- Willing to meet regularly, with and be supported by, inclusion staff- Can arrange to get to and from campus without STEPS Forward staff support- Being eligible for Community Living British Columbia (CLBC) services- Eligibility is NOT based on level of physical or cognitive ability, or a minimum level of reading, math, or other skill
